titleStmt.title: J. W. Combs et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7326

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Tho E Bramlette,
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

The undersigned citizens of Woodford County. having understood that James Jewell of Versailles was upon his confession fined $200. for permitting gaming &c in his house, and had or would petition your Excellency to remit said fine, most respectfully join in any petition he may make for such purpose -- and for these reasons --
We Know him to be a sober man, quiet in his habits, inoffensive and not prone to violation of law.

We Know that he Keeps a quiet orderly house, -- and although selling liquor, yet he makes every effort (in which he is more successful than most others in his business) to keep down noises and disturbances of every character.
He is Just commenceing life and to enforce the penalty would put him to an inconvenience that those older established could not appreciate

We therefore ask your Excellency to remit said fine so far as you have the power to do under the constitution and
laws of Kentucky

J W Combs sheriff
David P Robb Clerk Woodford Co Court
Swift Darneal Clerk of Woodford Circuit Court
Lee.. Atwell Jailor Woodford County

Woodford Cir Ct
vs
James Jewell
$200,
Gaming
Remit
8th Nov 1865
